pydexpi.syndata package

Submodules

pydexpi.syndata.generator module

This python class creates random dexpi P&ID using markov-like random sequences. Adopted from Vogel et al. (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compchemeng.2023.108162) and Hirtreiter et al. (https://doi.org/10.1002/aic.18259).

At the moment this only includes topological equipment and piping network systems.

class pydexpi.syndata.generator.SyntheticPIDGenerator(generatorFunction: GeneratorFunction, max_steps=100)

Bases: object

The generator contains mechanisms to connect patterns to a larger pattern and collect them in pattern distributions.

continue_loop()

Checks stopping criteria for P&ID generation. Stops if no open connectors are available or the maximum number of generation steps is reached.

generate_pattern()

Top-level function to create a random dexpi flowsheet

generate_pids(amount: int, savepath: Path)

Generates a given amount of P&IDs and saves them locally.

Parameters:

  • amount (int) – Number of P&IDs to be generated.

  • savepath (Path) – Storage path for P&IDs.

next_step()

Adds a further pattern to the P&ID.

pydexpi.syndata.generator_function module

class pydexpi.syndata.generator_function.GeneratorFunction(distribution_range: list[PatternDistribution])

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for the generator function. Generator function contains the logic of determining the next pattern to be connected, in accordance with the strategy design pattern. The logic follows:

f(current_pattern) = current_pattern_connection,

next_pattern, next_pattern_connection

abstract initialize_pattern() → Pattern

Initializes the P&ID generation with a seed pattern.

Returns:

Seed pattern to start the P&ID generation with.

Return type:

Pattern

class pydexpi.syndata.generator_function.MarkovChainGeneratorFunction(distribution_range: list[PatternDistribution])

Bases: GeneratorFunction

Example implementation of a generator function. Takes a random pattern and connects it to a random available connector.

The method invokes a connection between the connection and its counterpart. The implementation to this is subclass specific.

Parameters:

counterpart ((subclass specific type)) – The other connector that is to be connected to.

Returns:

This method only performs the connection in the pattern and deletes the connector object and its counterpart.

class pydexpi.syndata.pattern.Connector(label: str, reference_object: CustomAttributeOwner, **kwargs)

Bases: ABC

Pattern instances contain connectors. These contain information and logic on the connector that can be accessed by the generator to base its decision on connection on.

referenced_types

Abstract, static attribute. A tuple of types that may be referenced by this object

Type:

tuple of types

label

The label of the connector

Type:

str

kwinfos

A dictionary that contains relevant infos which can be retrieved by keyword. The contents can be dynamically manipulated during generation.

Type:

dict

add_dexpi_label()

Adds a label in the form of a custom attribute to the referenced object, so that it can be recovered after serialization.

abstract connect_to_counterpart(counterpart)

The method invokes a connection between the connection and its counterpart. The implementation to this is subclass specific.

Parameters:

counterpart ((subclass specific type)) – The other connector that is to be connected to.

Returns:

This method only performs the connection in the pattern and deletes the connector object and its counterpart.

Return type:

None

classmethod get_dexpi_custom_attribute_label()

Get the name of the attribute label associated to each of the connector subclasses, as used to store the reference in dexpi.

get_information()
classmethod import_from_valid_reference_object(reference_object: CustomAttributeOwner)

Create an instance from a valid reference object.

This class method attempts to create an instance of the class by searching for an associated custom attribute within the provided reference object. If no appropriate label is not found, a ValueError is raised.

Parameters:

reference_object (CustomAttributeOwner) – An object that contains custom attributes.

Returns:

An instance of the class initialized with the value of the found custom attribute and the reference object.

Return type:

instance of cls

Raises:

ValueError – If no appropriate label is not found.

abstract property referencable_types

Tuple of classes that are valid to be referenced. This static attribute is subclass-specific.

remove_dexpi_label()

Removes the custom attribute labels used for serialization from the referenced object to avoid artefacts in exporting patterns.

class pydexpi.syndata.pattern.Pattern(name: str, model: DexpiModel, connectors: list[Connector])

Bases: object

A pattern is a wrapper class for a DexpiModel for the generator. It describes a given P&ID state and contatins connector references as interfaces.

name

The name reference of the Pattern

Type:

str

model

The instance of the dexpi model wrapped by this pattern for the generator.

Type:

DexpiModel

connectors

The connectors associated to this pattern, defining its interfaces for connection by the generator.

Type:

list[Connectors]

connect_to_counterpart(own_connector: Connector, counterpart: Pattern, counterpart_connector: Connector) → Pattern

This method connects this pattern to another pattern via the connectors specified.

Note that the contents of the counterpart pattern are imported into this pattern, instead of generating a new pattern (Notably, the contents of its dexpi model, such as meta data). That way, e.g. the current_pattern in a generator can be conserved rather than having to be replaced at every step.

Parameters:

  • own_connector (Connector) – The connector in this pattern (self) that should be used for connection to the counterpart.

  • counterpart (Pattern) – The counterpart that should be connected and incorporated to this. pattern.

  • counterpart_connector (Connector) – The connector in the counterpart pattern that should be used for connection to this pattern (self).

Returns:

A reference to self after connection is completed.

Return type:

Pattern

Raises:

ValueError – If either the own_connector or the connector of the counterpart are not associated to the corresponding patterns.

classmethod init_by_inferring_connectors(name: str, model: DexpiModel)

This method acts as a second constructor in which the connectors are not passed explicitly, but are inferred by the labels in the dexpi model.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the pattern.

  • model (DexpiModel) – The model to be stored in the pattern.

Returns:

The newly generated pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

classmethod load_pattern(path_dir: Path, name: str, serializer: Serializer)

Loads a pattern in the directory specified in path_dir with the name given in name.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (Path) – The directory the pattern is saved in.

  • name (str) – The name of the pattern.

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer to be used for loading.

Returns:

The loaded pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

save_pattern(path_dir: Path, serializer: Serializer)

Saves a pattern to a directory in dirpath with the file name taken from its name attribute. For this, it uses the dexpi serializer specified in serializer.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (Path) – The path of the directory the pattern is stored in

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer object to be used for saving

pydexpi.syndata.pattern_distribution module

class pydexpi.syndata.pattern_distribution.PatternDistribution(name: str, distribution: dict[Pattern, float], connector_labels: list[str])

Bases: object

A PatternDistribution is a collection of Patterns that share the same properties with regards to the generation logic. The patterns are grouped for the sake of randomness and for structure. The grouping is based on similarity mainly regarding:

  • Outside connectors.

  • Transition logic.

  • Conceptual similarity (e.g. distillation equipment).

name

The name of the pattern distribution, preferably an umbrella term for the patterns contained.

Type:

str

distribution

The patterns contained in the distribution(keys), with the corresponding probabilities stored as the dictionary values.

Type:

dict[Pattern, float]

connector_labels

The labels of the connectors that each of the patterns in the distribution must contain.

Type:

list[str]

add_pattern(pattern: Pattern, probability: float, normalize: bool = True)

Add a pattern to the distribution with a specified probability.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the new patterndistribution

  • pattern (Pattern) – The pattern to be added to the distribution.

  • probability (float) – The probability associated with the pattern. Must be between 0 and 1.

  • normalize (bool) – Wherther the probabilities should be normalized after adding the pattern.

Raises:

ValueError – If the pattern does not contain all required connectors. If the pattern is already part of the distribution. If the probability is not between 0 and 1.

check_pattern_compatibility(pattern: Pattern)

Checks if the pattern is compatible with the pattern distribution, ie contains all required connector labels. Note that a pattern may have more connectors than the required ones to be valid.

Parameters:

pattern (Pattern) – The pattern to be evaluated for compatibility

Returns:

True if compatible, else False

Return type:

bool

classmethod load_distribution(dir_path: Path, name: str, serializer: Serializer)

Loads a distribution in the directory specified in path_dir with the name given in name, as previously saved by the save_distribution method.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (Path) – The directory the distribution is saved in.

  • name (str) – The name of the distribution.

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer to be used for loading.

Returns:

The loaded pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

normalize_probabilities()

Normalize the probabilities in the distribution so they sum to 1.

This method modifies the probabilities in the distribution such that the total sum of all probabilities equals 1. If the total probability is greater than 0, each probability is divided by the total probability.

random_pattern()

Samples a pattern from the distribution completely at random, disregarding the probabilities.

Returns:

The randomly sampled pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

sample_pattern()

Samples a pattern from the pattern distribution with respect to the probabilities of the distribution.

Returns:

The sampled pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

save_distribution(dir_path: Path, serializer: Serializer)

Saves a distribution to a directory in dirpath with the folder name taken from its name attribute. All patterns are saved in a new folder with the distribution name, using the dexpi serializer specified in serializer. Metadata, specifically the distribution probabilities, are saved along in a separate json in that folder.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (str) – The path of the directory the pattern is stored in

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer object to be used for saving
